name: places/ChIJsVXQJFj3wokRUesbkVRS78Q
formattedAddress: 372 Manhattan Ave, New York, NY 10026, USA
adrFormatAddress: 372 Manhattan Ave, New York, NY 10026, USA

originalText.text:
This is my first time leaving a review. I have got to say that Eric and his team were the absolute best experience I’ve had during my kitchen renovation. I used IKEA cabinets.

I had a very complicated galley kitchen because (1) most of the cabinets had to be cut to fit around a soffit and (2) the walls weren’t completely straight. IKEA’s installation service refused to touch this project. To complicate everything, I choose dark gray panels and shiny white cabinet doors. Meaning, anything that’s not perfect will easily be seen.

Eric came a day early prior to the start date to review the kitchen plan with me. He was not only unfazed by the technical challenges, but quickly saw errors in the IKEA plan and expertly rearranged all the cabinets on the fly. With these changes came needing additional cabinet parts, which he went personally to IKEA to pick up for me. Throughout the entire project he came reliably on time every day, was a perfectionist, and did additional IKEA runs as needed. Everything was done on time, on budget, and without a single blip to mention. Anything I mentioned as a request was happily discussed and no concern was too small for him to handle with finesse.

After the project finished and my appliances were installed, I asked if he could come back and put one last filler piece above the fridge. He did not hesitate to return promptly - even though he was already paid in full -  to add this small detail.

Just fabulous.
